title.rendered: Dig Your Way Through And Touch, by Evans Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 5:25-34, “…For she said, if I may touch but His clothes, I shall be whole…” Desperate people do desperate things if they know that whatever they’ve got to do will make an impact and a difference in their lives. When you know the restoration to your life depends on an extraordinary thing, you will not care about what people say or think. A woman with the issue of blood is in a situation where she has spent everything to fix her condition for 12years She has spent money, visited worthless physicians with no improvement. Her condition has robbed her of freedom, relationships, comfort, joy, peace and even money but she is determined to get well. At times you just need assurance that there is still hope in the midst of hopelessness and knowing that whatever is impossible with man is possible with God. She gets to hear about many things Jesus had done and she perceives in herself that her health will only come back through Jesus Christ. She is ashamed of herself and her condition that all she can say is that, ” if I may touch but His clothes, I shall be whole…”. Her faith is so much boosted to the extent that she knows that if just His name is a strong tower, then even power would flow through what He is wearing. I see her telling herself how she doesn’t even have to talk to Him or get noticed after all no one wants her around or be around her anyway. In my life I have seen areas that I really needed to touch the hem of His garment because I knew what I was going through and not every one would understand my situation. A desperation propelled me find Jesus and touch His garment. I believe that many times you will not have someone to help you find Him but yourself and you have to be strong enough to encourage yourself. “It shall be well” ought to be your attitude. She encouraged herself in the midst of hell and her encouragement helped her make the first move. Crawling under people trying to find her way to Jesus was her move. We don’t hear her telling people how she is too sick and she needs special help to reach to the Master, she decides to find her own way. When there is no one to carry you to the Master, calm and encourage yourself, crawl if need be, push the obstacles aside and make it to the Master. Something amazing is that everyone had been walking with Jesus and I bet there was no distance between Jesus and those that walked with Him. With that in mind, at least people touched Him whether they wanted to or not and Jesus never questioned them, but when this woman touched Him, He felt power leave Him and He stopped, looked around and asked, “WHO TOUCHED ME?”. Isn’t it funny that many people can walk around the Lord and even touch Him but there is no great impact but someone who has an extraordinary faith who needs something encourages herself just to touch His clothes and be made whole? When I have a desperate situation and I execute a desperate measure, I know that when I touch Him, He will stop and turn around to find me. Make prayers that causes heaven to be in motion and hell to be in chaos. All of sudden all attention is on a woman of faith. She was not even suppose to be there, she wasn’t even looking for attention to make the matters even more interesting, she wasn’t even expecting Jesus to look around and be concerned about her life but there she was. She has just touched His garments, she is made whole according to her faith and now the process is about to end. When she confesses that she is the one who touched Him, He turns around and says, “Daughter, your faith has made you well, go in peace and be healed of your affliction”. Can you imagine being called son or daughter when you were hopeless at one point? His love goes beyond our afflictions and He does care about what we go through. If He was able to pause for a second when He was on a journey and attend to this hopeless lady, don’t you think He will do the same for you? One last thing, if she touched His garment and got healed, why would Jesus tell her again to be healed? This was to let her know that it wasn’t a temporary healing but eternal and not only that, her sins were forgiven and complete restoration of all things were called back to her life (money, relationships, peace, joy etc). Dig your way through today and touch His garments.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“To keep me from becoming conceited because of these surpassingly great revelations, there was given me a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me. Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me. But he said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ’s power may rest on me. (2 Cor. 12:7 – 9)

Have you ever had a demonic attack upon your life? The Apostle Paul was demonized, oppressed, but not possessed. Upon hearing the word demon, many think of spiritual warfare, exorcism, prayer, etc…. However, the one word that most do not think of is the word that the Lord gave to Paul as an answer to his attack, his thorn in the flesh-his trial. Jesus said that what Paul needed was not more anointing, more faith, or even more prayer. He only needed grace, and not even need more grace, but the grace already supplied to him by Christ. He needed grace plus nothing! Paul was praying diligently so his prayer, his faith, and his commitment were not lacking. Why then would God allow an attack on his Apostle? Why does God allow you and I to be attacked?

First to one must understand grace as unmerited favor upon the ill-deserved or God’s Riches At Christ’s Expense. His grace was seen perfectly extended toward humanity at the cross. So why would God allow his beloved Apostle to be attacked.

1. God grace is unlimited. “My grace” Everything God has is perfect and limitless. He has perfect and limitless love, mercy, wrath, judgment, and power to heal and deliver. Grace belongs to God and He pours it where He wills. Romans 5:20 instructs, “Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound.” The law makes sin abound, but sin makes grace abound. Where one finds Satan, one will find sin, and where one finds sin, that’s where God’s grace abounds. God humbles the sinner, and gives grace to the humble (1 Peter 5:5). Did you forget He is unlimited?

2. God’s grace is sufficient. “My grace is sufficient” One can only fill up a glass of water so much before it overflows. God’s fills us up with his grace and it is enough, sufficient, all that we can house in our lives. However even with that, the emphasis is on the grace supplier, not upon the vessel to whom it is supplied. God gave Samson grace after Samson ruined his life by telling the secret of his strength and having his eyes plucked out. However God gave him grace, to which he didn’t deserve (Judges 16), but you and I don’t deserve his grace either. Are you satisfied with His grace alone?

3. God’s grace is for the humble. “…my power is made perfect in weakness.” “God resists the proud, and gives grace to the humble (1 Pt. 5:5).” God wanted to keep His Apostle humble, lest Paul think it was his own power and ability that was the reason for the gospel going forth. God didn’t want him falling through pride in his calling.

The demonic attack kept Paul humbly seeking His God. Paul eeded to remain small in his own eyes. Satan fires at those who have great potential for the Kingdom of God, especially in these last days. How is your pride and humility level? How’s your potential, are you capitalizing on it like Paul?

4. God’s Grace is to shine through you. “…that Christ’s power may rest on me.” We are to make grace amazing to the word, by shining His grace through our lives (Matt 5:16). Are you a light shining His grace?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me. But he said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for […]

content.rendered:
What Will Matter? 

Ready or not, some day it will all come to an end.
All the things you collected, whether treasured or forgotten will pass to someone else.
Your wealth, fame and temporal power will shrivel to irrelevance. It will not matter what you owned or what you were owed.
Your grudges, resentments, frustrations and jealousies will finally disappear. So too, your hopes, ambitions, plans and to do lists will expire.
The wins and losses that once seemed so important will fade away.
It won’t matter where you came from or what side of the tracks you lived on at the end.
It won’t matter whether you were beautiful or brilliant. Even your gender and skin color will be irrelevant.

So what will matter? How will the value of your days be measured?

What will matter is not what you bought but what you built, not what you got but what you gave.
What will matter is not your success but your significance.
What will matter is not what you learned but what you taught.
What will matter is every act of integrity, compassion, courage, or sacrifice that enriched, empowered or encouraged others to emulate your example.
What will matter is not your competence but your character.
What will matter is not how many people you knew, but how many will feel a lasting loss when you’re gone.
What will matter is not your memories but the memories that live in those who loved you.
What will matter is how long you will be remembered, by whom and for what.
Living a life that matters doesn’t happen by accident. It’s not a matter of circumstance but of choice. 


Choose to live a life that matters.

title.rendered: I’m Not Dead Yet, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
2Kings 7:1-20, “And there were four leprous men at the entering in of the gate: and they said one to another, why sit we here until we die?” There is such a great famine in the land of Samaria that everything is valued and expensive. The bible says that even the dung of a dove was considered precious and rare commodity that it had to be bought at a high price. This alone gives me a picture that there was such a great famine in this land. Now that we know of the situation, lets look at four men in vs. 3. These are men that have are just unfortunate in the society for no.1 they are lapours that makes their situation unbearable. Anyone who had leprosy in the olden times was out cast of the city and lived in caves, mountains or right out of the city. The lepers were always required to chant “I’m unclean, I’m unclean”. Situation number one looks severe then comes situation number two which is as lethal as number one and that is famine. Sick and no food, How much can a man take? They are aware of their situation as they are outcasts and they know that sooner or later they would die either by sickness or starvation or both. I love how they reason, vs. 3&4″…and they said one to another, why sit here until we die? if we say, We will enter into the city, then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there: and if we sit still here, we die also”. I thank God that during some tough times He still allows us to think and reason for though we may be handicapped in some areas, we are reminded that there are certain parts of our lives that still functions. I don’t want to throw everything out of the window simply because part of me is not functioning like it should. I maybe struggling in some areas and to me that is a leprosy and I might be going without the spiritual food for some unknown reason but I know that I am not dead yet so devil don’t bring me no casket for God has allowed other part of me to function. The other part of me will bring life at one point to the rest of my being. I see many beat themselves because what was working for them at one stopped. I believe that there are tanks God reserved for a time like this. You might have not known that you had a filled tank but what you are in right now allows Him to open this new tank to let you know you haven’t lost it all like you think. This is the time you see that you could do more with something you never thought you had. They lost friends, food, health, family but they did not loose their senses, the ability to reason. Yes they were limited but that did not stop them from thinking of the next move, it’s a risky move but they looked at every thing and they saw that either it could happen or fail. Four feeble men decided to match to the enemies camp in vs. 5, “And they rose up in the twilight, to go unto the camp of the Syrians”. They have no weapons, they are sick but they matched to the enemies camp. I know that there are times when God requires us to do the ridiculous things that He may show Himself as God in tough situations. There things He will not accomplish until we make the first move, until we want it badly that we are willing to do anything it takes to get it (pray, fast, seek, knock, ask). There are times when I feel that I have lost so much to function effectively, but those are the times I am reminded that I’m not dead yet, God had put a tank on reserve for a time like this therefore I will rise up again, take a step of faith and make a move. Phi 4:6, “Be careful for nothing….”. To finish

title.rendered: I’m Not Dead Yet, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 7:1-20, “And there were four leprous men at the entering in of

the gate: and they said one to another, why sit we here until we die?”

Vs 5&6.”And when they were come to the uttermost part of the camp of

Syria, behold, there was no man there. For the Lord had made the host

of the Syrians to hear a noise of Chariots, even the noise of horses,

even the noise of great host: and they said one to another, Lo, King if

Israel has hired against us the kings of Hittites, and the kings of the

Egyptians, to come upon us”. Very interesting, these men made a move

and God took over. You make a move and God will take over, think of

that something that you always wanted to accomplish but because of your

limitations you put it aside cause you saw that there was no way in the

world it could happen. Maybe you desired a promotion or a different job

but you did not have all the required stuff and you thought to

yourself, boy it cannot be mine. Well may I remind you of something,

you see the world crowns success while God crowns faithfulness, you may

not be successful but you can be faithful and that could be a great

strength an employer could be looking for. In God’s eyes we are not

dealt with by who we are and what we have accomplished but by what we

will be when He is done with us. It’s good to have the qualifications

but it’s a greater blessing when the Lord fights for you till the end.

I speaking this principle from experience. Somewhere in Romans 8 it

says, “them that He called, He justified and them that He justified,

He also glorified”. This is what faith is all about, hoping for those

things which are not seen and yet believing that they can happen. 2Cor

12:10, “Therefore I take pleasure in my infirmities, in reproaches and

necessities, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then

I am strong”. The verse is very true that when you are not that’s when

you are. The bible tells me that the moment they made a move, the Lord

multiplied the sound of their feet and they sounded like a mighty army.

Pause for a sec here, God did not change their condition but He changed

the way the enemy perceived them, God may not change your situation or

circumstance but He may allow the other person to see you not as a

whimp but as an asset. They are weak almost dying, they don’t have war

clothes and to make it worse, they are just four and yet they sound

like a mighty army? God I don’t know how you do it but it works. I may

never understand how you operate but I love to be part of your

operations.

The enemy did not care to check whether actually these were warriors

coming after them or not, they just fled leaving their tents, their

horses and everything fleeing for their lives. Greater is He that lives

in side of us than He that is in the world 1John 4:4,. Read the rest of

the story and you will see how they ate and drunk and had a good time,

they came and also mentioned it to the king of Israel of what happened.

The king of Israel thought the Syrians were playing a trick on them and

the Syrians thought Israel came to attack them while we know for sure

that God was in control of the destiny of these four men. All my life I

never got what I deserved or qualified for but what I desired to which

when I made a move, God stepped in and made the sound of my feet sound

like a mighty army and instead of being judged by what I had, I was

judged by what God could offer through me. So the things I have not yet

accomplished will not cause my dreams and desire to die. Though it

looks like nothing is happening and the conditions are getting bad,

part of me maybe affected and may not function effectively but that

will not hinder me from rising up and moving, I may be feeble and I may

not walk well but that is a good sign that I’m not dead yet, Psalm

118:17, “I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord”.

My life in Christ is a book yet to be written, a song yet to be sung, a

testimony yet to be testified, a desire yet to be fulfilled, can’t go

under just because I have leprosy in my life. I encourage you too not

to go down, thou something in your life maybe sucking life out of you

and at times you feel like this is it, well until God says it’s over

it’s not over yet, so check the other tanks you did not know you had,

rise up and use that gas to fuel you to the next destination for you

are not dead yet.

content.rendered:
Our Deepest Need is Love 

Within the heart of each of us, we have a need to love …
To be a part of something more than we feel worthy of. 

To rise above our human selves and reach the highest star…
While giving glory to the one who loves us, as we are. 

God creates in every soul a hunger for the Truth…
To make a difference in the world, as He has willed us to. 

But first, we must examine our roots and where we’ve been…
To put aside our selfish ways and look from deep within. 

There are miracles inside us, and gifts we haven’t used…
The best in life is yet to be, and we are free to choose! 

Let’s choose to build those bridges that reach the highest heights…
All the way to God above, where He directs each flight. 

No matter where we came from, our deepest need is love…
God within us will provide; He wants the best for us! 

“For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, 

that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. ” – John 3:16 

 

HAPPY VALENTINE’s DAY & HAVE A WONDERFUL DAY!!!
